title: Silver Flash Stakes
text:
The Silver Flash Stakes is a <a href="Group%20races">Group 3</a> <a href="Flat%20racing">flat</a> <a href="Horse%20racing">horse race</a> in Ireland open to two-year-old <a href="thoroughbred">thoroughbred</a> <a href="Filly">fillies</a>. It is run at <a href="Leopardstown%20Racecourse">Leopardstown</a> over a distance of 7 furlongs (1,408 metres), and it is scheduled to take place each year in July.
History.
The event was formerly held at <a href="Phoenix%20Park%20Racecourse">Phoenix Park</a> in early September. For a period it was run over 7 furlongs and classed at Listed level.
The race was transferred to Leopardstown and switched to late October in 1991. It was cut to 6 furlongs in 1993, and from this point it took place in early June. It was moved to July in 1999.
The Silver Flash Stakes reverted to 7 furlongs in 2007. It was promoted to Group 3 status in 2008.
